intro: Monnina alatodrupacea, commonly known as the winged monnina, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces distinctive seed pods that are often winged, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Monnina alatodrupacea is often found in rocky soils and can be seen in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
